actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of May 18, 89 with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 101-32.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 70.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the House.

actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported.
Reported by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-250.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 160.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-109.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to authorize the acceptance of certain lands for addition to Harpers Ferry National Historical Park, West Virginia.

summary.text: Increases the amount of land that the Secretary of the Interior may acquire for addition to Harpers Ferry National Historical Park, West Virginia. Authorizes the Secretary to acquire, by donation only, a limited amount of land outside the boundary of such park.

titles.title: A bill to authorize the acceptance of certain lands for addition to Harpers Ferry National Historical Park, West Virginia.
